HomePage.missionText: Revma is dedicated to supporting teachers with meaningful tools, resources, and community.

TeachingRoma.heroDescription: Revma is here to support educators with meaningful tools, resources, and real advice from teachers who have worked with Roma students across different communities.
TeachingRoma.submitSectionText: If you’re a teacher of Roma students, we’d love to hear your story or advice for others.
TeachingRoma.communityDescription: These centers offer valuable resources and support to teachers working with Roma students.
TeachingRoma.ctaDescription: If you’re a new teacher of Roma students, or simply looking for helpful educational materials and resources to better support your class, we’ve got you covered.

ResourcesPage.heroDescription: Lesson plans, activity guides, and cultural materials created to support Roma education.
ResourcesPage.categoryInclusiveDesc: Resources that promote equitable and supportive teaching.
ResourcesPage.categoryLinguisticsDesc: Materials about language development, multilingual practices, and communication strategies.
ResourcesPage.categoryRomaHistoryDesc: Content that explores the historical experiences of Roma communities.
ResourcesPage.categoryClassroomDesc: Lesson plans, worksheets, and in-class exercises designed to engage students in hands-on learning.
ResourcesPage.categoryGameDesc: Educational games and digital tools to promote engaging learning experiences.
ResourcesPage.categoryPlatformDesc: Comprehensive platforms offering structured resources for educators.
ResourcesPage.submitText: If you're a teacher and have found resources that support your work with Roma students—such as lesson plans, tools, or platforms—you can share them here for others to benefit.
ResourcesPage.modalInstructions: If you have a link to a resource, please paste it below. If you don’t have a link but would like to upload a file instead, you can leave the download link field empty and submit the form. A member of the Revma team will reach out to you via email to coordinate getting the file.
ResourcesPage.modalLink: Paste a download link (Google Drive, Dropbox, etc.)

InfoPage.heroTitle: Learn More About Roma Experiences, History, and Education
InfoPage.heroDescription: Explore key facts, concepts, and questions about Roma communities and education.
InfoPage.statsDescription: These figures highlight the educational challenges and disparities faced by Roma communities across Europe. Understanding these statistics is crucial to fostering inclusive and equitable education.
InfoPage.stat1Text: of Roma youth in Europe leave school early—before completing secondary education.
InfoPage.stat2Text: of Roma children in Greece attend segregated or Roma-majority schools.
InfoPage.stat3Text: of Roma children across the EU report facing discrimination in school environments.
InfoPage.stat4Text: of Romani guardians and students felt discriminated against when in contact with a school authority because of being Romani.
InfoPage.stat5Text: of Roma children live in households at risk of poverty or social exclusion.
InfoPage.stat6Text: of Roma that are school aged attend school.
